description.en:
Compilation of samples of the different types of JClic activities.
This package is just for testing and demo purposes.

messages.initial: Multimedia and animations

cells.text: In JClic cells can have different media and animations. It's possible also to record a sound from the microphone and listen it:

messages.initial: Sample of association with animated GIF
Another puzzle with animated GIF

initial.text: This is a direct association between text and graphics divided into rectangular sections.
In this association you must drag the words. The cells have transparent background.
Activity with transparencies and colour gradients
This is an association between two texts, but with a different number of elements in each window.
Identification activity: which verbs are in the past?

messages.initial: Another identification panel: Where is Australia?

initial.text: In this case it's about associating  text and areas of a graph.
This is an activity in which the operations are generated randomly, using the module "arith2"
Written response activity: what are these vehicles called?
This is an exploration activity. Click on the map to see the information associated with each zone.
How's your English coming on? In this association there are texts, graphics and sounds.
And in this one we use MIDI files.

elements.text: Many JClic activities (associations, puzzles...) use cells. With Clic 3.0 all the cells of a zone shared the same style: colour, size, typeface, etc. With JClic each cell can have independent attributes:
Cells can have text over a graphic

Cells can also have html content. For instance, this one has a table:
Hi!
where the Jurassic Park is?

initial.text: In this crossword, some of the clues are graphics.
... and in this one there are spoken definitions in English which must be written down.

cells.text: backward sticker on a dutch car?

elements.text: In text activities you can use
JClic projects can have embedded "TrueType" fonts, wich are dynamically loaded, without the need of install them on the system.
For instance, this text is written with the "HandSign" typeface, used for sign language:
Try to write in sign language:

messages.initial: In JClic the cells can be rectangles or have other shapes.

initial.text: This activity uses the "Holes" shaper
This activity must be solved using less than 10 attempts

messages.initial: This puzzle must be solved in less than 15 seconds

initial.text: What you want to see?

cells.text: • Examples of the different kinds of activities

initial.text: Examples of the 5 types of Clic activities
Click on the arrow to see the examples of associations

cells: The aim of the association activities is to discover the relationship between the elements of the different blocks of information.
The information to be related may be presented as text, graphics, sounds, animations, video or any other type of multimedia resource.
There are also some special activities included in this section, such as information screens.

initial.text: Click on the arrow to see examples of the crosswords

cells: JClic's crosswords are of the type that you see everyday in your newspaper...
...with the advantage that the clues for the crossing words are presented immediately.
The definitions are usually textual, but they can also be music or sounds.

initial.text: Click on the arrow to see the puzzle examples.

cells: The aim of the puzzles is to put the elements of a block of information in order.
This information may be text, graphic or sound.
The puzzles may be presented in four different modes: "exchange", "double", "hole" and "memory".

initial.text: Click on the arrow to see the examples of word searches.

cells: In the Word searches you have to find the hidden words, which may be written in any direction.
There is also the option that, as you find the words you uncover associated information.
The associated information may be textual, graphic,or sound.

initial.text: Click on the arrow to see the examples of the text activities

cells: The text activities are exercises in which you must correct, complete, order or identify determined elements of a text.
There are seven different forms of text exercises: written answer to cells, blank filling, text completion, identifying letters or words and ordering words or paragraphs.
The exercises may include graphics and sound, as well as different help elements.

initial.text: New features of JClic

cells.text: • Use of JPG, PNG, animated GIF and Flash movies

elements.text: Other new features of JClic activities
In this sequence some of the new features of JClic are shown:
- Maximum time to solve an activity.
- Activities limited to a maximum number of tries.
- To force the resolution of an activity in a certain order.
- Memory games with two blocks of information.
- TrueType fonts embedded in JClic projects
- Use of colours with alpha channel (transparency) and gradients.

messages.initial: This is a graphic puzzle of the "double" type
JClic can use cells with arbitrary shapes
... this is "exchange"...
... and this is the "hole" type.They're the most difficult!
You can also make puzzles with text,like this one.

initial.text: ... or with arithmetical operations. These have to be put in ascending order.
This is a memory puzzle: the aim is to find each pieces partner.
In this memory game you must discover couples of similar cells

messages.initial: Example of a puzzle with animated GIF
Example of a puzzle with animated GIF

initial.text: This puzzle uses the "TriangularJigSaw" shaper
This is the "ClassicJigSaw" shaper
This activity uses the "JigSaw" shaper, with random distribution of tooths.
The shaper "Holes" allows to define any kind of polygon, as well as circles, ellipses and Bézier curves.
Blue skin

elements.text: JClic allows the use of customized graphic frameworks, called "skins". The skin consists in a graphic design of windows, buttons and counters, and an XML file with data about the location of each element on the screen.
Each JClic project (or each activity inside a project) can have its own graphic framework.
This activity uses the "blue" skin. Click on the forward arrow button to see other examples.

initial.text: Orange skin

elements.text: This activity uses the "Orange" skin. It's similar to the "Blue" skin, but with different colours.
Click on the arrows to see more examples.

initial.text: "Simple" skin

elements.text: This is the graphic framework called "Simple".

initial.text: Scratch skin

elements.text: ... and this is a test skin with hand strokes and without counters (not yet implemented!)

initial.text: Mini skin

elements.text: This is the "mini" skin, suitable for activities embedded in small spaces
The next activity will use again the standard graphic framework of JClic.

messages.initial: An easy search: find the names of three composers.

initial.text: In this search there are the names of the countries of South-America. As you discover them a map will be revealed.

messages.initial: The same as before, but this time with a little music!

initial.text: event sounds

cells:
This activity uses a custom set of event sounds
Listen what happens when you click on the cells, when a mach is solved or failed, or when the activity is finished.

initial.text: Fill in the blanks with the name of each fruit
A gap-fill activity with combo boxes

txa06.txa.name: txa06.txa
txa06.txa.prevScreenText:
Here's an example of how to include a dictation in a text activity.

Click here to begin the activity. You will first hear the whole text and then you have to write the dictation bit by bit.

initial.text: Dictation: The valley of Núria

elements.text: The valley of Núria is on the southern side of the Eastern Pyrenees
answers: The valley of Núria is on the southern side of the Eastern Pyrenees

elements.text: There isn't a road to get there
answers: There isn't a road to get there

elements.text: the only means of transport is a funicular
answers: the only means of transport is a funicular

elements.text: The journey in the funicular takes us through an extremely beautiful and spectacular landscape
answers: The journey in the funicular takes us through an extremely beautiful and spectacular landscape

elements.text: The passengers enjoy the view of the majestic mountains
answers: The passengers enjoy the view of the majestic mountains

elements.text: and occasionally feel the thrill of crossing deep precipices
answers: and occasionally feel the thrill of crossing deep precipices

initial.text: Sodium, oxygene, uranium and iron are missing from this table. Where do they go?
Click on the gases

elements.text: Click on the stressed vowels in the words that have more than one vowel sound

elements.text: Mark the nouns in this text.

messages.previous: Read this text and click on the  text to start the exercise.
messages.initial: Arranging paragraphs: put this Nasreddin Hodja story in order.

elements.text: Nasreddin Hodja sometimes brought meat home, but never had the chance to eat it.
answers: Nasreddin Hodja sometimes brought meat home, but never had the chance to eat it.

elements.text: His wife either ate it herself or shared it with her friends, always offering the same excuse;
answers: His wife either ate it herself or shared it with her friends, always offering the same excuse;

elements.text: "The cat got it, I couldn't stop her."
answers: "The cat got it, I couldn't stop her."

elements.text: One day Nasreddin Hodja brought two kilos of meat home and gave it to his wife to cook.
answers: One day Nasreddin Hodja brought two kilos of meat home and gave it to his wife to cook.

elements.text: At dinnertime when his wife gave him the same excuse, he took the cat and put it on the scales.
answers: At dinnertime when his wife gave him the same excuse, he took the cat and put it on the scales.

elements.text: The cat weighed exactly two kilos.
answers: The cat weighed exactly two kilos.

elements.text: "Woman"- he said-" if this is the cat, where's the meat? And if this is the meat, where's the cat?
answers: "Woman"- he said-" if this is the cat, where's the meat? And if this is the meat, where's the cat?
